{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2503.24105v1", "title": "Data-Driven Distributed Output Synchronization of Heterogeneous
  Discrete-Time Multi-Agent Systems", "summary": "In this paper, we assume that an autonomous exosystem generates a reference
output, and we consider the problem of designing a distributed data-driven
control law for a family of discrete-time heterogeneous LTI agents, connected
through a directed graph, in order to synchronize the agents' outputs to the
reference one. The agents of the network are split into two categories:
leaders, with direct access to the exosystem output, and followers, that only
receive information from their neighbors. All agents aim to achieve output
synchronization by means of a state feedback that makes use of their own states
as well as of an estimate of the exogenous system state, provided by an
internal state observer. Such observer has a different structure for leaders
and followers. Necessary and sufficient conditions for the existence of a
solution are first derived in the model-based set-up and then in a data-driven
context. An example illustrates both the implementation procedure and the
performance of the proposed approach.", "main_category": "eess.SY", "categories": "eess.SY,cs.SY", "published": "2025-03-31T13:57:18Z"}
